solution_line_template: She orders {num_sandwiches} sandwiches that are ${sandwich_price} so they cost {num_sandwiches}*${sandwich_price} = $<<{num_sandwiches}*{sandwich_price}={cost_sandwiches}>>{cost_sandwiches}
The brie is three times more expensive than the ${salami_price} salami so the brie costs {brie_multiplier}*${salami_price} = $<<{brie_multiplier}*{salami_price}={cost_brie}>>{cost_brie}

She buys {olives_weight_fraction} pound of the olives that costs ${olives_price_per_pound} a pound so they cost {olives_weight_decimal}*${olives_price_per_pound} =$<<{olives_weight_fraction}*{olives_price_per_pound}={cost_olives}>>{cost_olives}

She buys {feta_weight_fraction} pound of feta that costs ${feta_price_per_pound} a pound so it costs {feta_weight_decimal}*${feta_price_per_pound} = $<<{feta_weight_fraction}*{feta_price_per_pound}={cost_feta}>>{cost_feta}

The salami is ${salami_price}, the brie is ${cost_brie}, olives are ${cost_olives} and the feta is ${cost_feta} and the sandwiches are ${cost_sandwiches} for a total of ${salami_price}+${cost_brie}+${cost_olives}+${cost_feta}+${cost_sandwiches} = $<<{salami_price}+{cost_brie}+{cost_olives}+{cost_feta}+{cost_sandwiches}={total_cost_before_bread}>>{total_cost_before_bread}
